projectPurpose: To provide a fast, efficient, and user-friendly command-line tool for recursively searching directories for text patterns using regular expressions, especially optimized for code search, by respecting ignore files and leveraging modern performance techniques.
mainFeatures: Recursively searches directories for a regex pattern
Automatically skips hidden files, directories, and binary files
Supports searching specific file types and excluding others

alternatives.name: grep
mainFeatures: Searches plain text using regular expressions
Supports basic and extended regular expressions
Options for case-insensitive search and inverted matching
Can show line numbers and colorized output

alternatives.name: ack
mainFeatures: Designed for programmers to search code
Recognizes and filters by file types

alternatives.name: The Silver Searcher (ag)
mainFeatures: Uses multiple CPU cores for parallel search
Supports regex and literal string searching

alternatives.name: git grep
alternatives.license: Open Source - GNU GPL (part of Git)
mainFeatures: Searches patterns in files tracked by Git
Faster than standard grep in Git repositories

alternatives.name: Platinum Searcher (pt)
mainFeatures: Similar interface to The Silver Searcher (ag)

marketPositioning: Ripgrep is positioned as the leading high-performance, modern command-line search tool specifically optimized for developers and codebases. It builds upon the core functionality of traditional tools like grep and the developer-focused features of ack and The Silver Searcher, but significantly surpasses them in speed and efficiency through its Rust implementation, parallel processing, and intelligent defaults like comprehensive .gitignore support and full Unicode handling. It aims to be the fastest and most capable recursive regex search tool available, offering first-class support across major operating systems.
